title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 1. These are the Avian Influenza (Biosecurity measures) Regulations 2024
text_raw:
1. These are the Avian Influenza (Biosecurity measures) Regulations 2024 

and come into effect on 6th December 2024.
text_norm: 1 avian influenza (biosecurity measures) regulation 2024 come effect 6th december 2024

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: In these Regulations:-
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations:- 

“poultry” means birds kept in captivity for the production of meat or eggs for 
consumption, the production of other products, for restocking supplies of game 
birds or for the purposes of breeding for the production of these categories of 
birds; 

“other captive bird” means a bird other than poultry that is kept in captivity.
text_norm: 2 regulation - poultry mean bird kept captivity production meat egg consumption production product restocking supply game bird purpose breeding production category bird captive bird mean bird poultry kept captivity

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her
text_raw:
3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her 
possession or under his or her control shall comply with the biosecurity 
measures- 

a) 

b) 

set out in Schedule 1, and 

in the case of a person who has 350 or more poultry or other 
captive birds in his or her possession or under his or her control, 
the biosecurity measures set out in Schedule 2.
text_norm: 3 (1) person poultry captive bird possession control shall comply biosecurity measures- a) b) set schedule 1 case person 350 poultry captive bird possession control biosecurity measure set schedule 2

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 4. Regulation 3 is a penal provision to which section 36 (4) (b) of the
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3 is a penal provision to which section 36 (4) (b) of the 

Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 applies. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 6th December, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [666] 3 

Regulation 3 (a) 

Schedule 1 

Biosecurity measures
text_norm: 4 regulation 3 penal provision section 36 (4) (b) animal health welfare act 2013 applies notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 6th december 2024 666 3 regulation 3 (a) schedule 1 biosecurity measure

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 1. All necessary measures to reduce the movement of people, vehicles or
text_raw:
1. All necessary measures to reduce the movement of people, vehicles or 
equipment to and from areas where poultry or other captive birds are kept shall 
be implemented. Inspections of poultry establishments shall continue to take 
place as deemed necessary by an official of the Department of Agriculture Food 
and the Marine.
text_norm: 1 necessary measure reduce movement people vehicle equipment area poultry captive bird kept shall implemented inspection poultry establishment shall continue take place deemed necessary official department agriculture food marine

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 2. All necessary measures to minimise the risk that poultry or other captive
text_raw:
2. All necessary measures to minimise the risk that poultry or other captive 
birds will become affected with avian influenza through exposure to manure, 
slurry or other products must be implemented.
text_norm: 2 necessary measure minimise risk poultry captive bird become affected avian influenza exposure manure slurry product must implemented

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 3. Effective vermin control, including preventing the entry of wild and
text_raw:
3. Effective vermin control, including preventing the entry of wild and 
domestic animals to land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are 
kept must be applied.
text_norm: 3 effective vermin control including preventing entry wild domestic animal land premise poultry captive bird kept must applied

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 4. Feed and bedding must be stored in such a manner that other animals,
text_raw:
4. Feed and bedding must be stored in such a manner that other animals, 

including wild birds, do not have access.
text_norm: 4 feed bedding must stored manner animal including wild bird access

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 5. A person who has contact with poultry or other captive birds must take
text_raw:
5. A person who has contact with poultry or other captive birds must take 
all reasonable measures to avoid the transfer of avian influenza virus to or from 
land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept, including 
cleansing and disinfection of equipment, vehicles and footwear that has been in 
contact with poultry or other captive birds.
text_norm: 5 person contact poultry captive bird must take reasonable measure avoid transfer avian influenza virus land premise poultry captive bird kept including cleansing disinfection equipment vehicle footwear contact poultry captive bird

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 6. The operator responsible for the poultry establishment must ensure that
text_raw:
6. The operator responsible for the poultry establishment must ensure that 
disinfection points containing sufficient amount of a disinfectant that is effective 
against avian influenza virus used in accordance with the manufacturer’s 
guidelines, are provided at all entry and exit points of land or premises where 
poultry or other captive birds are kept.
text_norm: 6 operator responsible poultry establishment must ensure disinfection point containing sufficient amount disinfectant effective avian influenza virus used accordance manufacturer guideline provided entry exit point land premise poultry captive bird kept

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 7. All necessary measures must be taken to prevent access by wild birds to
text_raw:
7. All necessary measures must be taken to prevent access by wild birds to 

land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept.
text_norm: 7 necessary measure must taken prevent access wild bird land premise poultry captive bird kept

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 8. Provide feed and water to poultry or other captive birds in such a way
text_raw:
8. Provide feed and water to poultry or other captive birds in such a way 

that is not accessible to wild birds.
text_norm: 8 provide feed water poultry captive bird way accessible wild bird

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 9. Take all necessary measures to prevent overgrowth of vegetation or
text_raw:
9. Take all necessary measures to prevent overgrowth of vegetation or 

accumulation of uncovered water on the land or premises.
text_norm: 9 take necessary measure prevent overgrowth vegetation accumulation uncovered water land premise

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 10. Remove anything that might attract wild birds from the premises such as
text_raw:
10. Remove anything that might attract wild birds from the premises such as 

fallen fruit or uneaten feed.
text_norm: 10 remove anything might attract wild bird premise fallen fruit uneaten feed

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 11. Inspect the fabric and structural integrity of any building used to house
text_raw:
11. Inspect the fabric and structural integrity of any building used to house 
poultry or other captive birds for holes and leaks, with particular emphasis on 
roofs, gutters and downpipes. Any holes and leaks must be repaired immediately 
to prevent water ingress.
text_norm: 11 inspect fabric structural integrity building used house poultry captive bird hole leak particular emphasis roof gutter downpipes hole leak must repaired immediately prevent water ingres

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 12. Take all necessary measures to thoroughly clean and disinfect housing
text_raw:
12. Take all necessary measures to thoroughly clean and disinfect housing 
and equipment at the end of each production cycle, using a disinfectant that is 
effective against avian influenza viruses in accordance with the manufacturer’s 
guidelines.
text_norm: 12 take necessary measure thoroughly clean disinfect housing equipment end production cycle using disinfectant effective avian influenza virus accordance manufacturer guideline

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 13. Keep records of all persons and vehicles that enter land or premises
text_raw:
13. Keep records of all persons and vehicles that enter land or premises 

where poultry or other captive birds are kept. 

 
 4 [666]
text_norm: 13 keep record person vehicle enter land premise poultry captive bird kept 4 666

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 14. Keep records of movement of poultry, other captive bird and eggs onto
text_raw:
14. Keep records of movement of poultry, other captive bird and eggs onto 

or off land or premises. Records must include the- 

(a) date of each movement, 

(b) 

(c) 

land or premises of origin or, as the case may be, destination, and 

the name and address of the person from or, as the case may be, 
to whom consigned.
text_norm: 14 keep record movement poultry captive bird egg onto land premise record must include the- (a) date movement (b) (c) land premise origin case may destination name address person case may consigned

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 15. All outdoor areas where poultry and other captive birds have access to
text_raw:
15. All outdoor areas where poultry and other captive birds have access to 

must be fenced to confine the birds and must be managed to ensure- 

(a) 

(b) 

the area is not contaminated with feathers or faecal material from 
wild birds and all reasonable steps are taken to remove such 
contamination that is present, 

access to open or permanent standing water is restricted by 
fencing off and netting ponds, standing water or waterlogged land 
to prevent access by poultry or other captive birds, 

(c) 

there is no direct contact with other poultry or other captive birds, 

(d) ducks and geese are kept separately from other poultry species, 

(e) 

(f) 

feed and water are kept indoors, 

poultry and other captive birds are fed indoors or under a covered 
area in a manner that prevents contact by wild birds with the feed 
and water, 

(g) measures are in place to ensure that wild birds are not attracted to 
areas in the vicinity of land or premises where poultry or other 
captive birds are located, in particular to watercourses, reservoirs, 
ponds or other standing water, 

(h) proactive measures are taken to discourage wild birds from 
entering the land or premises. For example streamers, bird scarers 
or foils, 

(i) 

(j) 

the carcases of wild birds are removed immediately, and 

regular cleansing and disinfection is carried out on all concrete 
walkways, paths and similar surfaces to which poultry and other 
captive birds, or wild birds have access. 

 
 
 
 
 
 Schedule 2 

[666] 5 

Regulation 3 (b) 

Additional biosecurity measures for land or premises with over 350 poultry or 
other captive birds.
text_norm: 15 outdoor area poultry captive bird access must fenced confine bird must managed ensure- (a) (b) area contaminated feather faecal material wild bird reasonable step taken remove contamination present access open permanent standing water restricted fencing netting pond standing water waterlogged land prevent access poultry captive bird (c) direct contact poultry captive bird (d) duck goose kept separately poultry specie (e) (f) feed water kept indoors poultry captive bird fed indoors covered area manner prevents contact wild bird feed water (g) measure place ensure wild bird attracted area vicinity land premise poultry captive bird located particular watercourse reservoir pond standing water (h) proactive measure taken discourage wild bird entering land premise example streamer bird scarer foil (i) (j) carcase wild bird removed immediately regular cleansing disinfection carried concrete walkway path similar surface poultry captive bird wild bird access schedule 2 666 5 regulation 3 (b) additional biosecurity measure land premise 350 poultry captive bird

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 1. Land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept shall be
text_raw:
1. Land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept shall be 

divided into 3 parts, as follows: 

(a) 

(b) 

one part in which live birds are kept, 

a part where ancillary activities, such as storage of feed, water and 
equipment are carried out, and 

(c) 

a restricted access part with a secure barrier.
text_norm: 1 land premise poultry captive bird kept shall divided 3 part follows (a) (b) one part live bird kept part ancillary activity storage feed water equipment carried (c) restricted access part secure barrier

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: Inspections of poultry establishments shall continue to take place as
text_raw:
2. 

Inspections of poultry establishments shall continue to take place as 
deemed necessary by officials of the Department of Agriculture, Food and the 
Marine.
text_norm: 2 inspection poultry establishment shall continue take place deemed necessary official department agriculture food marine

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 3. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which paragraph
text_raw:
3. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which paragraph 

1 (a) refers are - 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

access is restricted to essential personnel only, 

all persons must exercise effective barrier hygiene, including 
changing clothing and footwear before entering and on exit, 

the exterior of any vehicles, in particular wheels and wheel 
arches, and any equipment which enters or exits must be cleansed 
and disinfected on entry and exit, and 

(d) 

records must be maintained of vehicles and persons who enter or 
exit.
text_norm: 3 measure apply part land premise paragraph 1 (a) refers - (a) (b) (c) access restricted essential personnel person must exercise effective barrier hygiene including changing clothing footwear entering exit exterior vehicle particular wheel wheel arch equipment enters exit must cleansed disinfected entry exit (d) record must maintained vehicle person enter exit

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 4. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which paragraph
text_raw:
4. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which paragraph 

1 (b) refers are - 

(a) 

(b) 

access must be limited to essential personnel only with full 
biosecurity measures adopted on entry and exit, 

this part must be fully separated with clear demarcation from the 
part to which paragraph 1 (a) refers, 

(c) waste and carcases must be held in appropriately secure facilities 
in this part with clear separation from the other parts of the land 
or premises, 

(d) 

(e) 

 the exterior of any vehicles, in particular wheels and wheel 
arches, and any equipment which enters or exits must be cleansed 
and disinfected on entry and exit, and 

egg producers must ensure the packing, handling and storage of 
second quality eggs is managed in a secure manner. Where single 
use egg trays are not used, the egg trays must be cleansed and 
disinfected before use. 

 
 
 6 [666]
text_norm: 4 measure apply part land premise paragraph 1 (b) refers - (a) (b) access must limited essential personnel full biosecurity measure adopted entry exit part must fully separated clear demarcation part paragraph 1 (a) refers (c) waste carcase must held appropriately secure facility part clear separation part land premise (d) (e) exterior vehicle particular wheel wheel arch equipment enters exit must cleansed disinfected entry exit egg producer must ensure packing handling storage second quality egg managed secure manner single use egg tray used egg tray must cleansed disinfected use 6 666

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: 5. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which paragraph
text_raw:
5. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which paragraph 
1 (c) refers are access must be limited to essential persons and vehicles with full 
biosecurity measures adopted on entry and exit. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for 
Agriculture, Food and the Marine, 
 3 December, 2024. 

JUNE FANNING, 

 An officer authorised to authenticate the official Seal of 

the Minister.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013 (No.
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the biosecurity measures for poultry and other 
captive birds as a precautionary measure against risk of avian influenza. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 8 [666]
